newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile economy grows 4.5 percent in Q1 - Aninat.
newsitem.headline: Chile economy grows 4.5 percent in Q1 - Aninat.

text.p: Chile's economic growth slowed sharply to around 4.5 percent in the first quarter from 7.7 percent in the previous three months, said Finance Minister Eduardo Aninat on Monday.
"We estimate gross domestic product growth to be around 4.5 percent in real terms in the first quarter with spending growth at practically zero percent," Aninat told reporters.
Chile's economy expanded a strong nine percent in the first quarter of 1996.
Aninat made his estimate when commenting on the Central Bank's decision to cut interbank interest rates by 0.25 percentage point Friday.
The cut, the second in two months, followed a welter of figures showing the bank's tight policy had brought Chile's robust economic growth under control.
The bank took the decision after being assured that the economy will meet the 5.5 percent government inflation target this year, he said.

"We do not see any type of special pressure of cost or demand which will alter the goal to 5.5 percent inflation with growth close to a target we are calculating today of 5.8 percent," said Aninat. ((-- Rodrigo Martinez, Santiago newsroom, 562-699-5595 x212))
